intro: Thesium diversifolium, commonly known as the variable thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which is closely related to the grass family. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and vary in shape, contributing to its common name. Thesium diversifolium is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
